00122 char * nfsstat2_to_str( nfsstat2 code )
00123 {
00124   switch( code )
00125   {
00126     /* no nead for break statments,
00127      * because we "return".
00128      */
00129         case NFS_OK : return "NFS_OK";
00130         case NFSERR_PERM : return "NFSERR_PERM";
00131         case NFSERR_NOENT : return "NFSERR_NOENT";
00132         case NFSERR_IO : return "NFSERR_IO";
00133         case NFSERR_NXIO : return "NFSERR_NXIO";
00134         case NFSERR_ACCES : return "NFSERR_ACCES";
00135         case NFSERR_EXIST : return "NFSERR_EXIST";
00136         case NFSERR_NODEV : return "NFSERR_NODEV";
00137         case NFSERR_NOTDIR : return "NFSERR_NOTDIR";
00138         case NFSERR_ISDIR : return "NFSERR_ISDIR";
00139         case NFSERR_FBIG : return "NFSERR_FBIG";
00140         case NFSERR_NOSPC : return "NFSERR_NOSPC";
00141         case NFSERR_ROFS : return "NFSERR_ROFS";
00142         case NFSERR_NAMETOOLONG : return "NFSERR_NAMETOOLONG";
00143         case NFSERR_NOTEMPTY : return "NFSERR_NOTEMPTY";
00144         case NFSERR_DQUOT : return "NFSERR_DQUOT";
00145         case NFSERR_STALE : return "NFSERR_STALE";
00146         case NFSERR_WFLUSH : return "NFSERR_WFLUSH";
00147 
00148     default:
00149         return "/!\\ | UNKNOWN NFSv2 ERROR CODE";
00150   }
00151 }

00153 char * nfsstat3_to_str( nfsstat3 code )
00154 {
00155   switch( code )
00156   {
00157     /* no nead for break statments,
00158      * because we "return".
00159      */
00160         case NFS3_OK : return "NFS3_OK";
00161         case NFS3ERR_PERM : return "NFS3ERR_PERM";
00162         case NFS3ERR_NOENT : return "NFS3ERR_NOENT";
00163         case NFS3ERR_IO : return "NFS3ERR_IO";
00164         case NFS3ERR_NXIO : return "NFS3ERR_NXIO";
00165         case NFS3ERR_ACCES : return "NFS3ERR_ACCES";
00166         case NFS3ERR_EXIST : return "NFS3ERR_EXIST";
00167         case NFS3ERR_XDEV : return "NFS3ERR_XDEV";
00168         case NFS3ERR_NODEV : return "NFS3ERR_NODEV";
00169         case NFS3ERR_NOTDIR : return "NFS3ERR_NOTDIR";
00170         case NFS3ERR_ISDIR : return "NFS3ERR_ISDIR";
00171         case NFS3ERR_INVAL : return "NFS3ERR_INVAL";
00172         case NFS3ERR_FBIG : return "NFS3ERR_FBIG";
00173         case NFS3ERR_NOSPC : return "NFS3ERR_NOSPC";
00174         case NFS3ERR_ROFS : return "NFS3ERR_ROFS";
00175         case NFS3ERR_MLINK : return "NFS3ERR_MLINK";
00176         case NFS3ERR_NAMETOOLONG : return "NFS3ERR_NAMETOOLONG";
00177         case NFS3ERR_NOTEMPTY : return "NFS3ERR_NOTEMPTY";
00178         case NFS3ERR_DQUOT : return "NFS3ERR_DQUOT";
00179         case NFS3ERR_STALE : return "NFS3ERR_STALE";
00180         case NFS3ERR_REMOTE : return "NFS3ERR_REMOTE";
00181         case NFS3ERR_BADHANDLE : return "NFS3ERR_BADHANDLE";
00182         case NFS3ERR_NOT_SYNC : return "NFS3ERR_NOT_SYNC";
00183         case NFS3ERR_BAD_COOKIE : return "NFS3ERR_BAD_COOKIE";
00184         case NFS3ERR_NOTSUPP : return "NFS3ERR_NOTSUPP";
00185         case NFS3ERR_TOOSMALL : return "NFS3ERR_TOOSMALL";
00186         case NFS3ERR_SERVERFAULT : return "NFS3ERR_SERVERFAULT";
00187         case NFS3ERR_BADTYPE : return "NFS3ERR_BADTYPE";
00188         case NFS3ERR_JUKEBOX : return "NFS3ERR_JUKEBOX";
00189 
00190     default:
00191         return "/!\\ | UNKNOWN NFSv3 ERROR CODE";
00192   }
00193 }

00195 char * nfstype2_to_str( ftype2 code )
00196 {
00197   switch( code )
00198   {
00199     /* no nead for break statments,
00200      * because we "return".
00201      */
00202         case NFNON : return "NFNON";
00203         case NFREG : return "NFREG";
00204         case NFDIR : return "NFDIR";
00205         case NFBLK : return "NFBLK";
00206         case NFCHR : return "NFCHR";
00207         case NFLNK : return "NFLNK";
00208         case NFSOCK : return "NFSOCK";
00209         case NFBAD : return "NFBAD";
00210         case NFFIFO : return "NFFIFO";
00211 
00212     default:
00213         return "/!\\ | UNKNOWN NFSv2 TYPE";
00214   }
00215 }

00224      */

00230         case NF3SOCK : return "NF3SOCK";
00231         case NF3FIFO : return "NF3FIFO";
00232 
00233     default:
00234         return "/!\\ | UNKNOWN NFSv3 TYPE";
00235   }
00236 }

00247 uint64_t nfs_htonl64( uint64_t arg64 )
00248 {
00249     uint64_t res64 ;
00250 
00251 #ifdef LITTLEEND
00252     uint32_t low =  (uint32_t)(arg64 & 0x00000000FFFFFFFFLL) ;
00253     uint32_t high = (uint32_t)(( arg64 & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000LL ) >> 32 );
00254                 
00255     low = htonl( low ) ;
00256     high = htonl( high ) ;
00257 
00258     res64 = (uint64_t)high + (((uint64_t)low) << 32 ) ;
00259 #else
00260     res64 = arg64 ;
00261 #endif
00262 
00263     return res64 ;
00264 } /* nfs_htonl64 */
00265 
00275 uint64_t nfs_ntohl64( uint64_t arg64 )
00276 {
00277     uint64_t res64 ;
00278 
00279 #ifdef LITTLEEND
00280     uint32_t low =  (uint32_t)(arg64 & 0x00000000FFFFFFFFLL) ;
00281     uint32_t high = (uint32_t)(( arg64 & 0xFFFFFFFF00000000LL ) >> 32 );
00282                 
00283     low = ntohl( low ) ;
00284     high = ntohl( high ) ;
00285 
00286     res64 = (uint64_t)high + (((uint64_t)low) << 32 ) ;
00287 #else
00288     res64 = arg64 ;
00289 #endif
00290 
00291     return res64 ;
00292 } /* nfs_ntonl64 */

00294 #ifdef _HAVE_GSSAPI
00295 
00307 int log_sperror_gss( char * outmsg, char *tag, OM_uint32 maj_stat, OM_uint32 min_stat)
00308 {
00309         OM_uint32 smin;
00310         gss_buffer_desc msg;
00311         gss_buffer_desc msg2;
00312         int msg_ctx = 0;
00313         FILE * tmplog ;
00314 
00315         if( gss_display_status( &smin, 
00316                                 maj_stat, 
00317                                 GSS_C_GSS_CODE, 
00318                                 GSS_C_NULL_OID,
00319                                 &msg_ctx, 
00320                                 &msg)  != GSS_S_COMPLETE )
00321                 return FALSE ;
00322 
00323         if( gss_display_status( &smin, 
00324                                 min_stat, 
00325                                 GSS_C_MECH_CODE, 
00326                                 GSS_C_NULL_OID, 
00327                                 &msg_ctx, 
00328                                 &msg2 ) != GSS_S_COMPLETE ) 
00329                 return FALSE ;
00330 
00331         sprintf( outmsg, "%s - %s : %s ", tag, (char *)msg.value, (char *)msg2.value );
00332 
00333         gss_release_buffer(&smin, &msg);
00334         gss_release_buffer(&smin, &msg2);
00335 
00336         return  TRUE ;
00337 } /* log_sperror_gss */
00338 #endif
00339 
00351 void auth_stat2str( enum auth_stat why, char * str ) 
00352 {
00353    switch( why )
00354      {
00355         case AUTH_OK:   
00356                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_OK", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00357                 break ;
00358 
00359         case AUTH_BADCRED:
00360                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_BADCRED", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00361                 break ;
00362         
00363         case AUTH_REJECTEDCRED:
00364                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_REJECTEDCRED", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00365                 break ;
00366         
00367         case AUTH_BADVERF:
00368                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_BADVERF", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00369                 break ;
00370         
00371         case AUTH_REJECTEDVERF:
00372                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_REJECTEDVERF", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00373                 break ;
00374         
00375         case AUTH_TOOWEAK:
00376                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_TOOWEAK", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00377                 break ;
00378         
00379         case AUTH_INVALIDRESP:
00380                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_INVALIDRESP", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00381                 break ;
00382         
00383         case AUTH_FAILED:
00384                 strncpy( str, "AUTH_FAILED", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00385                 break ;
00386         
00387 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00388         case RPCSEC_GSS_CREDPROBLEM:
00389                 strncpy( str, "RPCSEC_GSS_CREDPROBLEM", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00390                 break ;
00391         
00392         case RPCSEC_GSS_CTXPROBLEM:
00393                 strncpy( str, "RPCSEC_GSS_CTXPROBLEM", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00394                 break ;
00395 #endif
00396 
00397         default:
00398                 strncpy( str, "UNKNOWN AUTH", AUTH_STR_LEN ) ;
00399                 break ;
00400      } /* switch */
00401 } /* auth_stat2str */
